title: The NASA Paper & Small Falcon Algebra: N/U Algebra Implementation
description: N/U (Nominal/Uncertainty) Algebra is a mathematically rigorous framework for propagating explicit uncertainty bounds alongside nominal values in safety-critical systems. Features conservative bounds (validated across 70,000+ test cases), O(1) computational complexity, deterministic behavior without distributional assumptions, and formal mathematical proofs of closure, associativity, and monotonicity. Suitable for aerospace engineering, metrology, psychological science, regulatory compliance, and real-time systems requiring audit-defensible uncertainty tracking.
references: JCGM 100:2008 - Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement (GUM)
Bomarito et al. (2021) - NASA Uncertainty Propagation Methods
